description: As Russian forces intensify their assaults on Kostiantynivka in an effort to encircle this city in the Donbas, firefighters continue to respond − all while working under the permanent threat of drones.

headline: US approves Gilead's twice-yearly injection to prevent HIV
description: Lenacapavir, marketed under the brand name Yeztugo, has been shown to reduce the risk of HIV transmission by more than 99.9% in adults and adolescents. Pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) drugs have existed for more than a decade, but because they typically require taking a daily pill, they have yet to make a significant dent.

description: UGC Ciné Cité Les Halles, a 27-screen complex in a central Paris mall, draws more than 2.8 million moviegoers annually.

headline: The US refusal to intervene in Syria in 2013: A French trauma
description: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (3/5). On August 31, 2013, as French warplanes were en route to Syria to launch a joint operation with the US against the regime of Bashar al-Assad, which had used chemical weapons against its own people, Barack Obama decided to delay, leaving France alone and powerless.

headline: 'On the budget, Donald Trump's obsession consists of fulfilling impossible campaign promises'
description: After 150 days in office, doubts about the US economic policy are mounting. Widespread uncertainty, serious damage to the country's credibility, and the rising deficit threaten the international financial system's stability, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.
